definition: lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: It's said that this Lord Ye was very fond of dragons.
sentences.chinese: 在一開篇，我想要說一個葉公好龍的故事。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities

definition: men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
